subject: Communication
title: The Inner Monologue: Your Biggest Listening Enemy
description: One-minute skill: The Inner Monologue: Your Biggest Listening Enemy.

hook.text: Someone is talking to you. But in your head, you're rehearsing your reply, judging their argument, and planning dinner.

buildup.text: The inner monologue runs constantly â€” planning, evaluating, rehearsing.

discovery.text: Research shows we spend 60% of conversations thinking about what to say next rather than processing what's being said.

twist.text: Silencing the inner monologue feels unnatural because it IS unnatural. Evolution wired us to prepare, not to absorb.

climax.text: Expert listeners don't silence the monologue. They redirect it â€” using it to summarize and question rather than to.

punchline.text: The voice in your head isn't the enemy. Where you aim it is what matters.

quiz.question: What percentage of conversations do we spend thinking about our response?
